attributes.comment:
The proposed fees are too low.
Fees should not only reflect costs of processing an application, but the impact on
the infrastructure and on American workers competing for jobs. For example,
employers and non-permanent resident aliens authorized to work other than based
on being granted refugee or asylee status should pay an impact fee as a
percentage of earnings. Once the worker becomes vested, by working here and
demonstrating their ongoing value by working here under this impact fee structure
for a number of years, they should then be allowed to apply for permanent
residence directly.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
